docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 14 (AP).--Three hundred refugee Jews from Germany and Italy who were on their way to make new homes in Paraguay found themselves stranded in Montevideo today as the Paraguayan Government canceled their visas.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 14 (AP).--Three hundred refugee Jews from Germany and Italy who were on their way to make new homes in Paraguay found themselves stranded in Montevideo today as the Paraguayan Government canceled their visas.
docs.abstract: Paraguay revokes immigration permits of 300 Jewish refugees leaving them stranded in Uruguay; others en route; France to limit immigration; Danzig to deport 1,000 Jews for undisclosed destination after confiscating property

headline.main: SHIFT BY PARAGUAY STRANDS 300 JEWS; Group Is Detained in Uruguay After Permits to Enter Are Revoked by Government DANZIG TO DEPORT 1,000 French Foreign Minister Says Country Cannot Admit Many More Refugees

docs.snippet: SHANGHAI, Jan. 15 (AP).--The number of German Jewish refugees here was swelled to more than 2,000 today with the arrival of two groups totaling 244.
docs.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI, Jan. 15 (AP).--The number of German Jewish refugees here was swelled to more than 2,000 today with the arrival of two groups totaling 244.
docs.abstract: 244 Reich Jews reach Shanghai; group held up by Paraguay willing to become farmers; Uruguay may permit them to remain; to take action to stop smuggling of Jews into Argentina

headline.main: 244 MORE REICH JEWS ARRIVE AT SHANGHAI; Group Held Up by Paraguay is Willing to Become Farmers

docs.snippet: PARIS, Jan. 16.--The administrative committee of the World Jewish Congress, meeting here today, adopted a resolution declaring Jews would not accept a solution of the German refugee problem that rewarded the Nazi regime with economic advantages in...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Jan. 16.--The administrative committee of the World Jewish Congress, meeting here today, adopted a resolution declaring Jews would not accept a solution of the German refugee problem that rewarded the Nazi regime with economic advantages in return for its...
docs.abstract: World Jewish Cong bars Reich ransom plan; praises Pope for stand on anti-Semitism; Dr N Goldmann criticizes League of Nations for permitting Danzig Nazis to expel Jews; Uruguay offers temporary haven to Jews en route to Paraguay; Maj F F Sharles submits plan to settle 100,000 Jews in Dominican Repub

headline.main: JEWISH CONGRESS BARS RANSOM PLAN; Goldmann at World Meeting in Paris Urges Demand for Equality in Negotiations

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BERLIN, Jan. 18.--The meeting scheduled for today between Dr. Hjalmar Schacht, president of the Reichsbank, and George Rublee, director of the Intergovernmental Committee on Refugees, was postponed until tomorrow.
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Jan. 18.--The meeting scheduled for today between Dr. Hjalmar Schacht, president of the Reichsbank, and George Rublee, director of the Intergovernmental Committee on Refugees, was postponed until tomorrow.
docs.abstract: Rublee-Schacht conf postponed; Dominican legation in Berlin denies plan to settle Jews; Hull praises Rublee; C S Dewey conf with U S Congressmen on plan to use Eur war debts owed U S as aid to Jewish migration; M C Taylor studies repts on refugee problem; Finance Mins of Brazil, Argentina and Uruguay to conf on immigration problems

headline.main: TALK ON REFUGEES IN BERLIN DELAYED; Schacht Unable to Get in Touch With Hitler or Goering on Reported Concessions DOMINICAN PLAN DENIED Rublee May Quit Post After Making Report at End of German Discussions

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Composed of young women hailing from several sections of the country, a squad of fourteen United States Field Hockey Association players sailed yesterday for British Guiana aboard the Royal Netherlands liner Crijnssen.
docs.lead_paragraph: Composed of young women hailing from several sections of the country, a squad of fourteen United States Field Hockey Association players sailed yesterday for British Guiana aboard the Royal Netherlands liner Crijnssen.
docs.abstract: U S Assn team sails for Brit Guiana exhibition games

headline.main: SQUAD OF 14 SAILS FOR BRITISH GUIANA; Field Hockey Group to Play 3-Game Series With Colony Team in Feature of Trip Miss Fuller in Group Captain to Be Picked
